author: mhuwiler
body:
#### PR description:

Backport of #32389 and subsequent fixes #32449 and #33491 

The proposed filter allows to select events where a given particle originates either directly
(daughter) or indirectly ((grand)^n-daughter) from a list of possible ancestors.
It also allows to filter on the immediate daughters of the said particle.
Kinematic selections can also be applied on the particle and its daughters.

Use case example: select a jpsi->mumu coming from any b hadron however long the decay chain is.

This is meant to be used for a MC production for an analysis suing UL samples, so a backport to 106X will be submitted too.

This filter is inspired to
https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/blob/master/GeneratorInterface/GenFilters/plugins/PythiaFilterMultiMother.cc
but it enhances the capabilities by allowing to walk back the ancestry.

- We need a backport in order to benefit from these functionalities in CMSSW 10.6 releases used for UL MC production. 

#### PR validation:
Checked that the code compiles and when runs as intended, e.g.

	J/psi(1S) [-13, 13] pt 8.35,      genealogy:  <--  chi(c0)(1P) <--  B(c)+
	J/psi(1S) [-13, 13] pt 21.24,     genealogy:  <--  chi(c2)(1P) <--  B(c)+
        J/psi(1S) [-13, 13, 22] pt 9.16,  genealogy:  <--  B(c)+
Followed the instructions here
http://cms-sw.github.io/PRWorkflow.html

The report of runTheMatrix.py -l limited -i all --ibeos is attached
[runall-report-step123-.log](https://github.com/cms-sw/cmssw/files/5643401/runall-report-step123-.log)

Code checks have been performed and included in the commit.
title: Backport PythiaFiltertMultiAncestor to CMSSW_10_6 releases
